title.narrative: Agreement between Sida and NIB on Grodno WW Project
Beslut om insatsstöd till Grodno WW Project

description.narrative: The implementation of the investment programme in Grodno experienced a major set-back in June 2019 when the contract with the Polish construction company Ecolog had to be terminated. The reason for the termination of the contract was that Ecolog had continously failed to meet contract deadlines and that the company had run into financial difficulties. This meant that a procurement for a new building contractor had to be arranged, which has both led to delays and cost increases. According to assessments made by the PIU-consultant there will not be sufficient project funds to cover investments for the originally planned scope for the investment programme, which means that the investments may need to be downscaled. The procurement is currently ongoing and should be finalized during 1H 2020. In connection to the termination of the contract with Ecolog a performance guarantee in the amount of 1.7 MEUR was called from the bank of the contractor. These funds were then taxed by the Belarusian tax authorities at a rate of 35%, which is in contradiction of the loan agreement between NIB and the Belarusian government. According to this agreement all funds for this project shall be exempt of taxes. NIB has made considerable efforts during 2019 and 2020 to reverse this decision, which includes letters being addressed to the Belarusian Prime Minister and a meeting with the Belarusian Deputy Prime Minister Mr Kukharev. This has resulted in Belarus adopting a Presidential Decree revoking the decision of the Belarusian Tax Authority, which ultimately made the taxed funds availble for the project again. A further problem is that the Grodno water utility has refused to extend the PIU-consultancy contract longer than June 2020, stating that there are lack of funds to finance these services. These services are financed by Sida through the same trust fund with NIB that is channelling investment grants to the Grodno project. Evidently this is a way for the Grodno water utility to retain as much investment grant funds as possible. This has created further difficulties in implementing this project as the presence of a PIU-consultant is a necessary prerequisite for this kind of investment projects with IFI-financing. The presence of a PIU-consultant is also a binding condition of the NIB loan agreement for the loan agreement to be effective. Negotiations are currently ongoing to extend the PIU-contract to June 2020 to safeguard PIU-services until the procurement process for a new building contractor has be completed. Once the construction contract has been completed the financial situation for the investment programme will be more clear. In parallel to the investments into the upgrading of the Grodno wwtp an institutional reform in the Belarusian water sector has also been undertaken where the water tariff has been gradually increased. In the beginning of the program the cost recovery level of the water tariff was at roughly 40%. This level has been gradually increased by continuous tariff increases and by end 2018 the level of cost recovery for Grodno was at 124% which is very good.
